page.title: 15Local History Continued.
page.content: {Maesllwch Castle. Until the death of William Vaughan in 1582 Maesllwch had been for many centuries the property of the Vaughans who also owned 8 messuages, 8 gardens, 1 water corn grist mill, 300acres of woodland in Glasbury, Llowes,and Boughrood.The Castle was largely demolished in 1951.A part was repaired and preserved to make a reasonably sized house in which the DeWinton family now live.They have 10 usable rooms these are split up into 3 flats, one for the Major and his wife,one for his son and one for his daughter when she visits.Their central heating was gas made in the gas house.They have 1 cleaner,an outdoor swimming pool and an ornamental garden where part of the old house used to be.There are about ten houses on the estate all occupied by his workers.He owns 1,300acres.
